meanings.definition: Having too many people or organisms in a certain area.
meanings.sent1: The city felt overpopulated with so many buildings and people crammed together.
meanings.sent2: The zoo became overpopulated with too many animals in a small space.
meanings.sent3: The classroom seemed overpopulated with students, like sardines in a can.
meanings.sent4: The garden was overpopulated with weeds, suffocating the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The ant hill was overpopulated, bustling with activity and movement.

meanings.definition: To fill with an excessive number of people or organisms.
meanings.sent1: The new housing development will overpopulate the once quiet neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: If we keep feeding the birds, we might accidentally overpopulate our backyard.
meanings.sent3: The picnic area was overpopulated with ants after the food was left unattended.
meanings.sent4: The pond quickly overpopulated with fish after the accidental release of a few.
meanings.sent5: The gardeners decided not to overpopulate the flower bed with too many plants.
